Summary: The Aloft Beijing Haidian is a modern and stylish hotel with a trendy lobby decor. It is located next to the Four Points Hotel in the Haidian district.

The Ascott Beijing offers spacious, well-furnished apartments with amenities like fully equipped kitchens, laundry facilities, and LCD TVs. It is located in the CBD, near a subway station, with on-site restaurants and a mini-mart.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is a traditional-style hotel located in a hutong (maze of alleyways), offering a glimpse into old Beijing. It is a short walk to Tiananmen Square and provides amenities such as free internet, Chinese or Western breakfast, and a mobile phone for use during the stay.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a unique cultural experience away from typical tourist hotels, with traditional Chinese decor, gardens, and courtyards. It features modern amenities like in-room computers with internet access and flat-screen TVs, appealing to travelers seeking a blend of authenticity and convenience.

Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens, dining areas, and washer/dryers, including 3-bedroom options suitable for large groups. Rooms feature flat-screen TVs with cable and access to amenities such as a workout room.
The hotel has a coffee shop in an older part of the building with lots of character, and a lobby bar. Rooms were recently refurbished and are modern.

The Far East Hotel/Hostel is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, offering a glimpse into "real China." The hostel features a courtyard that serves as a communal meeting space with a friendly atmosphere.

The Friendship Hotel is a large complex with multiple buildings in a garden setting, featuring restaurants like TGI Fridays and a supermarket. Some reviewers describe it as quirky with a blend of traditional Beijing architecture and remnants of its Soviet-era origins.
The hotel was recently remodeled before the Olympics and is decorated in a modern, hi-tech style. The lobby is clean and has a 5-star feel.
The Beijing Hotel is connected to the Raffles Hotel, and some found the beauty of the hotel faded when comparing it to other hotels. One reviewer described the decor as bland and slightly depressing.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews contain information about the hotel feeling effortlessly cool.

The Jade Youth Hostel has a communal bar/lounge and a large common area with a TV, stereo, couches, and books. It is described as more like a hotel than a cozy hostel, with clean rooms and a modern shower room.

The Sihe Hotel is a small, traditional courtyard hotel located in a quiet hutong in central Beijing, offering a unique cultural experience away from large, Western-style hotels. It features traditional Chinese furnishings, clean rooms, and a peaceful courtyard, with convenient access to the metro and tourist attractions.

The Radegast Beijing is a modern, new hotel with spacious, well-appointed rooms featuring sophisticated lighting systems, electric curtains, and flat-screen TVs, with some bathrooms including a TV. It is located in the central business district, close to upscale shopping and the CCTV building.

The Capital Hotel has a large, elegant lobby with statuettes and a live fish tank, a bowling alley, and multiple restaurants. Some reviewers describe it as having a grand, soviet-style feel, while others mention its modern amenities and recent renovations.

The China World Hotel boasts a grand lobby with live music, opulent public areas, and modern, well-equipped rooms, offering a luxurious experience with high service levels. It's connected to a shopping mall with designer stores and is located near a subway stop for easy access to tourist sites.

The City Hotel is located next to several pubs and local restaurants that cater to foreigners, and is a short walk to the subway. Some rooms have multiple single beds, and some reviewers have noted the rooms can be in shabby condition.

The Commune by the Great Wall is a collection of architect-designed villas spread along a valley, offering a unique experience with private access to an unrestored section of the Great Wall. The hotel features modern architecture, multiple restaurants, and spa facilities.

Courtyard 7 is a renovated courtyard hotel in the old part of Beijing, located off Nanluoguxiang, a street with designer shops, bars, and restaurants. The hotel features traditionally-designed furnishings, courtyards with trees and lanterns, and is near nightlife options like Mao Live House and Yu Gong Yi Shan.

The hotel is connected to the New World Shopping Center which includes familiar US chains like Starbucks, McDonalds, and Pizza Hut. The hotel has been recently renovated with clean and well-designed rooms.
The hotel is modern with sleek, new rooms and ultramodern bathrooms. It features a modern gym, lap pool, and hot tub.

The hotel is modern, luxurious and well-decorated, with a stunning atrium and multiple restaurants and bars, including a lobby bar with live music and a Purple Bar. It is centrally located in the Wangfujing shopping district near night food markets, with convenient access to tourist sites.
The hotel lobby has a fresh, softly scented air. The hotel is well-appointed with quality, stylish materials.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing Intl Airport Hotel is a modern hotel with spacious rooms, multiple bars and lounges, and a gym. The hotel is located close to the airport and exhibition center, but far from the city center.
The hotel is described as clean, modern, and well-appointed, with spacious rooms and a superb lobby bar. Some reviewers mention nice decor and a good set of restaurants.
The hotel is new with a trendy design, and the rooms are spacious. It has a nice spa with a swimming pool and saunas.

The Days Inn Forbidden City is a modern, clean hotel with contemporary, IKEA-ish style rooms and flat screen TVs, located near major attractions. Some reviewers described it as a stylish boutique hotel.
The hotel is modern with clean rooms, white duvet coverings, flat-screen TVs, and massage shower heads. Some reviewers mentioned that the hotel didn't feel Chinese and could be in Tucson.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is located in a hutong (traditional alleyway) and features traditional Chinese decor, including carved wooden furniture and silk bedspreads. The hotel has a courtyard, free internet, and is located near a police station.
The Doubletree by Hilton Beijing is a relatively new and modern hotel with spacious rooms, stylish decor, and a rooftop garden. It also has a cozy bar on the ground floor.
The hotel is elegant with a Vegas-like mall in the basement that contains restaurants, boutiques, spas, and a gym/pool. It is located in the northwest part of the city, with taxis readily available.
The Fujian Hotel has a mix of Chinese and Western guests, and the lobby is attractive. The hotel had renovations in April and contains a small shop on the ground floor.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews contain any information about the hotel feeling effortlessly cool.

The Grand Hotel Beijing is described as a traditional hotel with spacious rooms, a luxurious feel, and classical charm with cultural significance imbedded within each aspect of the hotel's design. It features a magnificent spiraling staircase, a 3-story tall painting, and chairs made to resemble Ming Dynasty stools.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing has a lobby bar, the Red Moon bar with live music and a cigar room, and a pool decorated like a tropical forest with simulated stars. The hotel is connected to a high-end shopping mall and is within walking distance of the Wangfujing shopping area.

The Grand Mercure Xidan Beijing has a beautiful lobby with pottery, glasswork, an aquarium, and a lounge with a bar, as well as a pool, spa, sauna, and fitness center. It is located near shopping, restaurants, and public transit, and has free wireless internet in the lobby.

The Grand Millennium is a modern hotel with a stylish lobby, spacious rooms, and flat-screen TVs with free internet; it is located in Beijing's central business district, next to the subway. The hotel has a jazz bar that some found noisy, and is near trendy restaurants, but some taxi drivers may not know how to get there.

The hotel has a traditional Chinese architectural style with a piano in the lobby and rooms with kettles and tea. It also has a disco, snooker table, and bowling alley in the basement, as well as a garden accessible from the hotel.

The hotel has newly renovated superior business rooms with a modern look, complimentary WIFI, and is connected to a shopping complex. It is located near the Beijing Pedestrian Road, convenience stores, restaurants, street food, and bars.
I am sorry, the provided reviews do not contain information to answer the query, as no reviews mention if this hotel feels effortlessly cool.

The Hebei Guest House is a courtyard hotel located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, within walking distance of the Forbidden City and other attractions. It offers basic, functional rooms, as well as courtyard suites that are more spacious and renovated.
The hotel is modern, has been recently renovated, and has stylishly designed rooms with breathtaking views. The hotel has a lobby bar and is located near the Lufthansa Center mall.
The Hilton Beijing Wangfujing has modern rooms with features like automatic curtains, flat-screen TVs, and rainfall showers. The hotel also has a bar called Flames that aims to attract trendy locals.

The hotel has several restaurants including a steak house, Thai, Indian, and Italian options, along with a pub. The hotel also has a bowling alley and shops, and is located near the Lido Place shopping mall.
The Holiday Inn Central Plaza Beijing is a modern and stylish hotel, noted for its contemporary color schemes and minimalist decor. The lobby is spacious, and rooms are well-furnished and updated.

The hotel has an "executive floor" with a study decorated with age-old china and books to showcase Chinese culture, and rooms on the executive floor are comparable to a 5-star hotel in the US. The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood in western Beijing, a bit far from the city center but close to the subway.
The hotel has been renovated with modern, tastefully decorated rooms including flat screen TVs. Some reviewers mention the hotel being old and tired, but that renovations are in progress.
The hotel is modern and new, with large LCD TVs in the rooms. It is located near the Olympic Stadium and has a subway stop nearby.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews contain the information necessary to respond to your query.

The Holiday Inn Express Wangjing is a new hotel with modern furniture and amenities, flat-screen TVs, and free internet. It is located next to the Focus Mall and Hua Tang Shopping Center, and near a shopping plaza with restaurants and a supermarket.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven has a modern lobby and spacious rooms, with updated furnishings on the executive floors. Some reviewers noted a karaoke lounge and that the hotel attracts a younger crowd due to its value.
The hotel has modern, clean rooms but is located at the end of a street with major construction. It has limited English-speaking staff and few Westerners.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is a small, beautifully designed and chic hotel located in a quiet hutong in the center of Beijing. It has uniquely decorated rooms, a stylish lounge with art, and a courtyard for relaxation.

Hotel G is a trendy boutique hotel with modern design, retro furniture, and colorful window lighting. The rooms are spacious and equipped with amenities such as free Wi-Fi, iPod docks, and L'Occitane toiletries.

The hotel is a new Ibis located next to the Sanyuanqiao subway station on line 10, the first stop on the Airport Express train; it's behind the Novotel in the Phoenix City development, an up-and-coming area. The hotel offers free in-room internet, international TV channels, and a 24-hour snack bar.
The hotel has a beautiful lobby and was undergoing renovations at the time of review. Some rooms are described as royal with excellent, large bathrooms and city views.

The New Otani is a modern Japanese-owned hotel with Euro/Modern furniture and a lobby bar, offering amenities expected of a 5-star hotel, including satellite TV and internet access. It features thematic restaurants, an indoor pool, tennis/basketball/volleyball courts, and a luxury day spa with a beauty salon.

The Howard Johnson Paragon is connected to a shopping mall and close to the subway, with a train station across the street. The hotel has large LCD TVs, and some rooms have a glass wall separating the shower room and bedroom.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not mention the vibe or atmosphere of the hotel. They do focus on value, cleanliness, location, and service.

The hotel is located in a busy shopping district with malls and fast food restaurants, frequented mostly by teenagers and few non-Chinese people, giving it a local feel. The hotel is not luxurious, but is clean and safe, and is close to the subway and other attractions.

The Intercontinental Beijing Beichen is a modern and classy hotel located near the Olympic Green and venues like the Bird's Nest and Water Cube. It features amenities like large plasma TVs, well-equipped work desks, and modern bathrooms, with some rooms offering views of the Olympic venues.

The Intercontinental Beijing is a modern hotel with contemporary-styled rooms, LCD TVs, and glass-walled bathrooms; some reviewers mention the hotel's fleet of BMWs and high-end stores in the lobby contribute to an upscale feel. The hotel features live music at the Steak Exchange and a lightly scented reception area that creates a cozy ambiance.

The Jade Garden Hotel has an interesting history as a guesthouse during the Long March and later as a headquarters for some Communist leaders, and was completely redone for the Beijing Olympics. Rooms include flat screen TVs, internet access, and free bottles of water.

The hotel has been renovated with modern, clean rooms, some featuring balconies with garden views and walk-in showers. It's described as a smaller hotel, popular with foreigners, with a lobby coffee and tea service, pastry shop, and live music in the bar.

The hotel has a Beijing Opera theme with nightly performances in its theater and features multiple restaurants including the Apollo. It is located a short cab ride away from Tiananmen Square, the Temple of Heaven, and the Pearl Market.

The Jinqiao Hotel Apartments offers apartment-style accommodations with amenities like a kitchen, washing machine, and free internet. The ground floor includes a Western-themed restaurant with a bar and pool table, along with a supermarket, pharmacy, shops, a travel agent, and a hair salon.
The hotel is modern, located next to the Joy City shopping mall, and close to the subway. Rooms include amenities like HDTVs, kitchenettes, and free internet access in some rooms.

The JW Marriott Beijing features modern, chic decor with dark lighting and a minimalist-like lobby. Rooms are well-furnished with the "latest and greatest" amenities, including flat-panel HDTVs, and bathrooms with water-resistant TVs.
Hotel Kapok is a modern, boutique hotel with a sleek design, glass-walled bathrooms, and hardwood floors. The hotel is located near the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping area.
Kelly's Courtyard is a 9-room accommodation that is tastefully decorated, with jazzy ambient music and a glass-covered courtyard. It features a mezzanine reading lounge and a sunny roof terrace.
The hotel is located close to the subway and attached to the Lufthansa Shopping Centre. It has a German-style bar, Paulaner, which brews its own beer on site.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel is a new, modern hotel with spacious, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and large marble bathrooms with separate showers and tubs. It features a pool, gym, spa, and is conveniently located near shopping areas, restaurants, and transportation.

Lee Gardens Service Apartment Beijing is located near the Wangfujing shopping area, close to many attractions, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. The hotel offers serviced apartments with kitchens, laundry machines, and access to a gym and pool.
The Legendale Hotel in Beijing features rooms equipped with flat-screen LCD TVs and DVD players. Its health club includes two jacuzzies, a steam bath, and a sauna.

The Loong Palace is described as a gorgeous, world-class hotel with spacious, clean rooms and excellent facilities including a spa, bowling alley, and recreation center. It features a mix of Western and Chinese decor, and is located outside the city center near the Great Wall and Ming Tombs.

The hotel has a Scandinavian-designed loft-style apartment with Ikea-styled furnishings, a DVD player, and a sound system. There is a cafe at the corner of the building and a 24-hour 7-Eleven across the street.

The Marco Polo Parkside Hotel offers spacious rooms with luxurious interiors, stylish bathrooms that have a glass wall between the bath and bedroom, and modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and internet access. Some reviewers noted the hotel's understated elegance and proximity to the Olympic Park.
The hotel rooms are large and nicely decorated, with some offering a great view of the CCTV tower. The lobby is limited and small, but it has Wifi access.

The Marriott is a new hotel with spacious 2-bedroom apartments featuring fully equipped kitchens, multiple flatscreen TVs, and modern amenities. It also has a gym, swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, and steam room.
The Marriott City Wall has modern and chic public areas, new facilities, and a trendy open lobby bar. Some rooms have views of Beijing and the decor is beautiful.

The Mercure Wanshang has a modern layout, color scheme, and gym; some rooms have free internet, tea, and coffee. It is located a 5-10 minute walk from the subway, which is about 40 minutes from downtown.

Michael's House is a small, family-run boutique hotel with unique traditional decor, a glass-roofed lobby, and a courtyard setting. It is located in a non-touristy area, within walking distance of the subway, offering a glimpse into the local Beijing lifestyle.

The hotel is located on Wangfujing Street, near a subway station and shopping areas, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. Rooms are modern in style with nice bathrooms, and some have soundproof windows.

The hotel lobby, dining facilities, and executive floors have been refurbished, and rooms on the executive floors are modern with LCD TVs. There is a bar/cafe in the lobby, and a small grocery store on the same floor as the swimming pool.

Several reviewers mention that the lobby is beautiful and stylish, but the rooms are often described as shabby, small, and in need of renovation with dated decor. Some reviewers noted the hotel is located in the business district and not close to tourist sights.

The hotel has a large and impressive lobby, and rooms are decorated in a modern and zen style with renovated bathrooms that include large comfy showers. Some reviewers mention the lobby bar is expensive, but comfortable and relaxing with beautiful bartenders.

The hotel lobby has been remodeled with marble and blonde woods, and a gallery area features a live jazz pianist and doubles as an art gallery. Rooms in the A tower may be less modern than those in the B tower.

The Oakwood Residence Beijing offers large, comfortable flats with fully equipped kitchens and laundry machines. It is located near modern shopping malls, restaurants, and bars, with easy access to the city via taxi.
The Orange Hotel is a modern hotel located close to the subway, with clean rooms and a restaurant next door. The hotel provides little snacks and a pet goldfish to each room.
The Oriental Bay International Hotel has a modern aesthetic with spacious rooms and a magnificent lobby. The hotel is located near a metro station for easy access to Beijing central.
The hotel features modern furnishings, plasma TVs, and stone-floored showers, and some rooms have been renovated with newer interiors. Some rooms have a waterfall shower head and luxury linens.
The hotel features dark wood decor aiming for an "Old World" ambience and boasts a garden complex accessible to guests. Some rooms have modern bathrooms, and suites are available.

The Marriott Palm Springs offers spacious apartments with hardwood floors and marble bathrooms, providing a luxurious feel, and is located within an upscale, secure apartment complex with landscaped grounds. Guests have access to a well-equipped athletic club with a large indoor pool and first-class locker rooms.

The Park Hyatt Beijing features sleek and modern interior designs, with an avant-garde black aesthetic in public spaces. Rooms have a Sino-Japanese style with limestone baths, heated floors, and high-tech Japanese toilets.

The hotel has stylish decor, modern amenities, and a cool revolving door entrance, with Ferrari and Rolls Royce dealerships nearby. It is located in a high-end area, with modern, spacious, and spotless rooms.
The hotel is owned and run by the police department. It has a large flat screen with free internet in the king size bedroom and offers free internet connection directly on the TV.

The hotel is modern and well-kept with clean and comfortable rooms, and has several restaurants including Chinese and Japanese options. Rooms feature modern furniture and amenities such as tea/coffee making facilities and complimentary water.

The Prime Hotel has a modern, stylish feel with spacious rooms, attractive lobbies, and up-to-date amenities such as plasma TVs and free internet. It is centrally located near shopping and tourist attractions.
This hotel is a brand new design hotel with chic decor, modern bathrooms, and spacious rooms. It has a pool, spa, gym, and is located near a subway station and a shopping mall.

The hotel has modern decor, spacious rooms, and unique design features such as a glass bathroom enclosure with an unnecessary shower curtain. It is located on a street full of restaurants and is within walking distance of the metro.

The Raffles Beijing is described as elegant but not stuffy, with a grand lobby, historic charm, and comfortable rooms with tasteful furnishings and Tibetan wool rugs. Some reviewers mention the hotel's luxurious atmosphere, excellent service, and convenient location near shopping and historical sites like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The Renaissance Capital Hotel in Beijing is a modern hotel built around 2008, located in the Chaoyang District near the CBD and a subway station. It features contemporary decor, glass-walled bathrooms, and modern technology in the rooms.

The hotel is modern, new or recently renovated, with tasteful, functional, subtly luxurious rooms. It is located in the northeast part of the city near embassies, shopping, western-style bars, and Chinese restaurants, with a Starbucks next door.

The Shangri-La Beijing has a great bar and lounge, and a garden bar that is a great place to enjoy a drink and a Beijing night. The rooms are well-decorated, clean and modern, and the hotel caters to westerners.

The Kerry Centre has a "hip bar/restaurant" in the lobby called Centro, which attracts locals and is a "hot spot" for late-night drinks. The hotel also has a 24-hour bar and a shopping mall with a supermarket.

The Shatan Hotel is located on a small, authentic hutong street near the Forbidden City, offering a glimpse into local Beijing life with nearby markets and restaurants. The hotel features modern, clean rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs and internet access, blending convenience with cultural immersion.

The Sofitel Wanda Beijing is a new and stylish hotel with a modern lobby, well-equipped rooms, and amenities such as a gym, pool, and multiple restaurants. The hotel is located in the CBD/Financial area, near subway lines and a Walmart.

The hotel has a charming building reminiscent of old Chinese houses, located in a quiet area next to a metro station, allowing exploration of narrow streets and old neighborhoods. It is within walking distance of the drum and bell tower and a short subway ride to other attractions.
The hotel offers 1- and 2-bedroom suites with marble floors and counters. Amenities include a pool and gym.

The Spring Garden Hotel is a small courtyard-style hotel with traditional Chinese decor, located in a hutong. It has a quiet courtyard, rooms furnished with antique reproductions, and offers cultural experiences like dumpling-making.

The Sunworld Hotel is located just off Wangfujing Street, a main shopping area, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable, with amenities such as a TV with English channels, a safe, and a minibar.
The Swissotel Beijing features modern decor and common areas that have been recently renovated, creating a classy atmosphere. The hotel also has a pool, gym and several restaurants.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic experience of local life. The hotel features a central courtyard covered with a glass roof, creating a cozy lobby/living room area.

The Aman Summer Palace is located on the grounds of the Summer Palace and incorporates buildings that were guest houses in the Qing dynasty. The property's design incorporates local culture and historical significance with luxurious amenities.

The Emperor Hotel is a modern, funky boutique hotel with rooms named after Chinese Emperors and decorated in bright pastel colors. It features a rooftop bar with views of the Forbidden City, a free minibar, and interesting design elements like a shower with sound and view to the room.

The Opposite House is a modern, minimalist hotel with unique design elements like wooden bathtubs and floor-to-ceiling windows and is located in the trendy Sanlitun district, known for its nightlife, shops, and restaurants. The hotel features a lobby resembling a modern art gallery, a bar, a club, and offers amenities such as a complimentary mini-bar and Maserati airport transfers.

The Peninsula Beijing features a lobby bar that acts as a meeting place for young, hip locals, and has luxury brand outlets including Harry Winston, Chanel and Gucci. Some found it luxurious but lacking personality.

The Regent Beijing is a modern, sleek hotel with a Lamborghini and Rolls Royce dealership located in the lobby. The hotel has spacious rooms with frosted glass and rich draperies, as well as a sexy glass bathroom to bed view.

The Ritz-Carlton Beijing Financial Street is a modern, luxurious hotel with stylish decor, a spa, and an indoor pool featuring a large movie screen. It is located in the financial district, near a shopping mall with Western restaurants.

The Ritz Carlton Beijing has a modern dark chic theme, located in a modern, safe and quiet area close to the metro station and a high-end shopping mall. The hotel features a pool, spa, and gym, with a top-notch business center in each room.

The St. Regis Beijing has an understated elegance and class, with a lobby bar and sitting area. Some found it not as opulent or modern as other hotels, with decor that is a bit dated and an atmosphere that is business-oriented and official.

The Westin Beijing Chaoyang is a modern hotel with high-tech equipped rooms featuring automated window blinds, rainforest showers, and a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom. Some reviewers found the hotel design impressive, with a glass-caged indoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness equipment.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street features stylish rooms, modern decor, and a calming atmosphere, with a pool area described as stunning. The hotel is located in Beijing's Financial Street, near a luxury mall.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel has an Asian-influenced style with a central atrium featuring palm trees and fountains and soft music in the evening. Some reviewers note the hotel has a dated style, but others appreciate it as part of its charm.

The hotel is located in a quiet Hutong, just off Wangfujing Ave, close to a pedestrian street and subway line 5. It offers spacious rooms with hardwood floors and amenities like ironing boards, and the staff speaks English.
The Tiantan Hotel has rooms with a modern feel, marble or granite surfaces, and rich wood furniture. It also has a full-service spa/salon.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention any information that could be related to the query about finding a "cool" hotel. The reviews focus on the hotel's convenience for business travelers, location, and service.
The Traders Upper East hotel is a modern business hotel with clean rooms and western bathrooms. It has a gym that is open until 11pm, and an iSpa in the basement.

I am sorry, but I cannot identify if this hotel feels effortlessly cool. The reviews mention that the hotel is in a good location, is clean, and has friendly staff, but also note that some rooms are worn and in need of remodeling. There is a nightclub in the hotel, but reviews do not specify that it is "cool".

The hotel has multiple restaurants, including Korean, Japanese, and Izakaya options and a bar, but many close early. It is located near universities, with many cheap Korean and Japanese dining options nearby, frequented by international students.
The hotel has a stylish decor, a lush lobby with marble and crystal, and large rooms with flatscreen TVs. It also offers leisure facilities like a swimming pool, bowling alley, and billiards.
Xinyuan Inn is located in a modern, touristy hutong and offers an authentic Chinese experience. It is within walking distance of many sights and has good bus access.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located near the Xidan shopping area and subway station, with a main reception on Level 8; it also contains multiple restaurants including a Korean buffet. Rooms are spacious, though some reviewers found the beds hard and the temperature difficult to control.

The Xiyuan Hotel has a revolving restaurant with international buffet meals and a grill room, but some reviewers noted that parts of the hotel, including some rooms, appeared "tired" or "dated". Some reviewers noted that the hotel is located near the Beijing Zoo and Carrefour.

This hotel has chic and stylish rooms with functional design, comfortable beds, crisp white sheets, and a bathroom with a walk-in shower. Rooms include amenities such as aromatherapy pillows, anti-allergen pillows, fluffy white bathrobes, and soft slippers.

The Zhong An Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing life, and is close to the Beijing Railway Station and subway. Some reviewers describe it as a "Chinese hotel" with a youth hostel feel.
